questions.question: Which one of these was not a beach landing site in the Invasion of Normandy?
Who discovered Penicillin?
In what year did the Wall Street Crash take place?
Which of the following African countries was most successful in resisting colonization?
Which of the following ancient peoples was NOT classified as Hellenic (Greek)?
Which famous world leader is famed for the saying, Let them eat cake, yet is rumored that he/she never said it at all?
The collapse of the Soviet Union took place in which year?
How was Socrates executed?
Who was among those killed in the 2010 Smolensk, Russia plane crash tragedy?
What is the historical name of Sri Lanka?
Painter Piet Mondrian (1872 - 1944) was a part of what movement?
Which time signature is commonly known as 'Cut Time'
Which artist's studio was known as The Factory?
What year did Albrecht Durer create the painting The Young Hare?
Which of these are the name of a famous marker brand?
Which artist's style was to use small different colored dots to create a picture?
Which of these is not an additional variation of the color purple?
Who designed the Chupa Chups logo?
The painting 'The Starry Night' by Vincent van Gogh was part of which art movement?
Who painted the epic mural Guernica?
The derisive acronym 'PIIGS' refers to which of the following European countries and their economic statuses?
What is the capital of Senegal?
What is the most populous Muslim-majority nation in 2022?
What is the official German name of the Swiss Federal Railways?
What is the capital of the US State of New York?
Identify the noun in the following sentence: The mailman Mr. Joe was carrying postcards.
Identify the pronoun in the following sentence: Everyone is sleeping in the dorm room
Identify the verb in the following sentence: She bought a new car and started taking her driving lessons.
Identify the Adverb in the following sentence: The dog looked at his owner curiously.
Identify the adjective in the following sentence: Linda McKenzie has five children
Identify present, past or future tense from the following sentence: It rained heavily.
Identify the correct sentence.
questions.1: The weather is wet windy, unpredictable.
questions.2: The weather is wet, windy, unpredictable.
questions.3: The weather is wet, and windy and unpredictable.
questions.4: The weather is wet, windy and unpredictable.

questions.question: Identify the correct sentence.
questions.1: Dont worry, every little thing is going to be alright.
questions.2: Don’t worry. Every little thing is going to be alright.
questions.3: Don’t worry every little thing is going to be alright
questions.4: Dont worry, every little thing is gonna be alright

questions.question: Identify the preposition in the following sentence: The kids are sitting around the block.
Identify the synonym from the option given below: Nice
Which one of the following is a legal responsibility?
questions.1: Making sure your children get an education if you are a parent.
questions.2: Locking your car after parking it if you are a motorist.
questions.3: Making sure all your employees receive regular training if you are an employer.
questions.4: Caring for your partner if they are ill.

questions.question: Identify one characteristics for possible discrimination protected by the Equality Act.
Which reason best explains why the age of criminal responsibility is different in different countries?
questions.1: Governments have different amounts of youth crime to deal with.
questions.2: Some governments are signed up to the ‘United Nations Convention on the Rights of the Child’ but others are not.
questions.3: Governments in Less Economically Developed Countries (LEDCs) sometimes don’t have courts suitable for trials of young people.
questions.4: Governments hold different views about the age at which children understand the impact of their actions on others.

questions.question: When would a democratic government usually restrict freedom of speech?
questions.3: when jokes are made about politicians and religious leaders
questions.4: when individuals are at risk of significant damage

questions.question: Which piece of evidence is the most useful in deciding whether a law is working?
questions.4: Judges say that the law is easy to understand.

questions.question: Which reason best explains why a person accused of an offence would seek advice from a solicitor?
questions.1: Solicitors can provide legal aid to help with costs.
questions.2: Solicitors can use their legal powers to settle disputes.
questions.3: Solicitors provide free advice and only charge to represent people in court.
questions.4: Solicitors are independent of the police, government and local authorities

questions.question: Which responsibility is carried out by devolved governments in Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland?
Which reason best explains why a coalition government would be formed?
questions.1: one political party wants to form a government on its own but did not win a majority following an election
questions.2: one political party gained a majority following an election and wants to form a government on its own
questions.3: no single political party gained an overall majority following an election
questions.4: two political parties gain equal votes following an election and cannot agree who should form the government

questions.question: Which reason best explains why cabinet government is favoured in the United Kingdom (UK)?
questions.1: Different interest groups can be represented by all the political parties in the cabinet.
questions.2: Ministers can make better decisions by discussing them with colleagues.
questions.3: Civil servants and politicians can have an equal say.
questions.4: The devolved governments of Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland can be properly represented.

questions.question: What is Black Rod’s ceremonial role in Parliament?
questions.1: Calling MPs to attend the House of Lords
questions.4: making sure MPs speak in the correct order
